00016 
00017 package WeBWorK::Utils::DelayedMailer;
00018 
00019 use strict;
00020 use warnings;
00021 use Carp;
00022 use Net::SMTP;
00023 use WeBWorK::Utils qw/constituency_hash/;
00024 
00025 sub new {
00026     my ($invocant, %options) = @_;
00027     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00028     my $self = bless {}, $class;
00029     
00030     # messages get queued here. format: hashref, safe arguments to MailMsg
00031     $$self{msgs} = [];
00032     
00033     # SMTP settings
00034     $$self{smtp_server} = $options{smtp_server};
00035     $$self{smtp_sender} = $options{smtp_sender};
00036     $$self{smtp_timeout} = $options{smtp_timeout};
00037     
00038     # extra headers
00039     $$self{headers} = $options{headers};
00040     
00041     # recipients are checked against this list before sending
00042     # these should be bare rfc822 addresses, not "Name <email@addr>"
00043     $$self{allowed_recipients} = constituency_hash(@{$options{allowed_recipients}});
00044     
00045     # what to do if an illegal recipient is specified
00046     # "croak" (default), "carp", or "ignore"
00047     $$self{on_illegal_rcpt} = $options{on_illegal_rcpt};
00048     
00049     return $self;
00050 }
00051 
00052 # %msg format:
00053 #   $msg{to}      = either a single address or an arrayref containing multiple addresses
00054 #   $msg{subject} = string subject
00055 #   $msg{msg}     = string body of email (this is what Mail::Sender::MailMsg uses)
00056 sub add_message {
00057     my ($self, %msg) = @_;
00058     
00059     # make sure recipients are allowed
00060     $msg{to} = $self->_check_recipients($msg{to});
00061     
00062     push @{$$self{msgs}}, \%msg;
00063 }
00064 
00065 sub _check_recipients {
00066     my ($self, $rcpts) = @_;
00067     my @rcpts = ref $rcpts eq "ARRAY" ? @$rcpts : $rcpts;
00068     
00069     my @legal;
00070     foreach my $rcpt (@rcpts) {
00071         my ($base) = $rcpt =~ /<([^<>]*)>\s*$/; # works for addresses generated by Record::User
00072         $base ||= $rcpt; # if it doesn't match, it's a plain address
00073         if (exists $$self{allowed_recipients}{$base}) {
00074             push @legal, $rcpt;
00075         } else {
00076             if (not defined $$self{on_illegal_rcpt} or $$self{on_illegal_rcpt} eq "croak") {
00077                 die "can't address message to illegal recipient '$rcpt'";
00078             } elsif ($$self{on_illegal_rcpt} eq "carp") {
00079                 warn "can't address message to illegal recipient '$rcpt'";
00080             }
00081         }
00082     }
00083     
00084     return \@legal;
00085 }
00086 
00087 sub send_messages {
00088     my ($self) = @_;
00089     
00090     return unless @{$$self{msgs}};
00091     
00092     my $smtp = new Net::SMTP($$self{smtp_server}, Timeout=>$$self{smtp_timeout})
00093         or die "failed to create Net::SMTP object";
00094     
00095     my @results;
00096     foreach my $msg (@{$$self{msgs}}) {
00097         push @results, $self->_send_msg($smtp, $msg);
00098     }
00099     
00100     return @results;
00101 }
00102 
00103 sub _send_msg {
00104     my ($self, $smtp, $msg) = @_;
00105     
00106     my $sender = $$self{smtp_sender};
00107     my @recipients = @{$$msg{to}};
00108     my $message = $self->_format_msg($msg);
00109     
00110     # reduce "Foo <bar@bar>" to "bar@bar"
00111     foreach my $rcpt (@recipients) {
00112         my ($base) = $rcpt =~ /<([^<>]*)>\s*$/;
00113         $rcpt = $base if defined $base;
00114     }
00115     
00116     my %result;
00117     
00118     $smtp->mail($sender);
00119     my @good_rcpts = $smtp->recipient(@recipients, {SkipBad=>1});
00120     if (@good_rcpts) {
00121         my $data_sent = $smtp->data($message);
00122         unless ($data_sent) {
00123             $result{error} = "(Error number not available with Net::SMTP)";
00124             $result{error_msg} = "Unknown error sending message data to SMTP server";
00125         }
00126     } else {
00127         $result{error} = "(Error number not available with Net::SMTP)";
00128         $result{error_msg} = "No recipient addresses were accepted by SMTP server";
00129     }
00130     
00131     # figure out which recipients were rejected
00132     my %bad_rcpts;
00133     @bad_rcpts{@recipients} = ();
00134     delete @bad_rcpts{@good_rcpts};
00135     my @bad_rcpts = keys %bad_rcpts;
00136     if (@bad_rcpts) {
00137         $result{skipped_recipients} =
00138             { map { $_ => "(Server message not available with Net::SMTP)" } @bad_rcpts };
00139     }
00140     
00141     return \%result;
00142 }
00143 
00144 sub _format_msg {
00145     my ($self, $msg) = @_;
00146     
00147     my $from = $$self{smtp_sender};
00148     my $to = join(", ", @{$$msg{to}});
00149     my $subject = $$msg{subject};
00150     my $headers = $$self{headers};
00151     my $body = $$msg{msg};
00152     
00153     my $formatted_msg = "From: $from\n"
00154         . "To: $to\n"
00155         . "Subject: $subject\n";
00156     if (defined $headers) {
00157         $formatted_msg .= $headers;
00158         $formatted_msg .= "\n" unless $formatted_msg =~ /\n$/;
00159     }
00160     $formatted_msg .= "\n$body";
00161     
00162     return $formatted_msg;
00163 }
00164 
00165 1;
